    • Method Detail

      • publishSurface

        void publishSurface()
        Publishes the current surface so that it can be used.

      • updateSurface

        void updateSurface()
        Updates the currently published surface.

        This indicates that the surface's properties may have changed.

      • recallSurface

        void recallSurface()
        Recalls the currently published surface so that it's won't be used anymore.

      • createSurface

        void createSurface(int width,
                   int height)
        Creates a surface with the given properties and assigns it as current.

        If a surface name has been set with setSurfaceName(String) it will be used, otherwise a default name will be generated.

        Parameters:
        width -
        height -

      • createSurface

        void createSurface(IScreenViewport viewport,
                   org.joml.Matrix4f projectionMatrix)
        Creates a surface with the given properties and assigns it as current.

        If a surface name has been set with setSurfaceName(String) it will be used, otherwise a default name will be generated.

        Parameters:
        viewport -
        projectionMatrix -

      • updateSurface

        void updateSurface(int width,
                   int height)
        Updates the current surface with the given properties.
        Parameters:
        width -
        height -

      • updateSurface

        void updateSurface(IScreenViewport viewport,
                   org.joml.Matrix4f projectionMatrix)
        Updates the current surface with the given properties.
        Parameters:
        viewport -
        projectionMatrix -

      • getSurface

        ISurface getSurface()
        Returns the surface created by createSurface(int, int).
        Returns:
        The current surface, or null if there is none.

      • setSurfaceName

        void setSurfaceName(String name)
        Sets the name that will be used for the surface.

        Only has an effect if called before createSurface(int, int).

        Parameters:
        name -

      • getSurfaceName

        String getSurfaceName()
        Returns:
        The set surface name, or a generated one if no name has been set.
